intro: Babiana sulphurea, commonly known as the yellow babiana, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It features striking yellow flowers that resemble those of the daffodil, with three petals and three sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in grassland habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Babiana sulphurea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
